title: Setup & Auth
description: Getting started with CLASP and authentication

cards.description: Authorizes clasp to manage your Google account's Apps Script projects. Creates a credentials file for future use.
cards.whenToUse: Required before using any other clasp commands. Run this when you first install clasp or need to switch accounts.
scenarios: First-time setup: After installing clasp globally, run this to authorize access
New machine: Setting up clasp on a new development computer
After logout: Re-authenticating after signing out

cards.task: Sign out from your Google Account
cards.description: Removes the stored credentials from your local machine, terminating the current session.
cards.whenToUse: When switching accounts, securing a shared computer, or troubleshooting auth issues.
scenarios: Account switching: Logging out before authenticating with a different Google account
Security: Removing credentials from a shared development machine
Troubleshooting: Clearing stored credentials when experiencing permission errors

cards.task: Display the authorized Google Account email
cards.description: Shows which Google account is currently authenticated and being used by clasp.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to verify which account you're operating under.
scenarios: Account verification: Confirming you're using the correct account before pushing
Multi-account management: Checking which account is active
Troubleshooting: Verifying authentication when experiencing permission errors

cards.task: Authenticate for CI/CD pipeline on a headless server
cards.description: Disables the local redirect server during authentication, requiring manual code entry instead.
cards.whenToUse: When setting up clasp in CI/CD pipelines, Docker containers, or remote servers without GUI.
scenarios: GitHub Actions: Authenticating in a CI runner where you can't launch a browser
Docker container: Setting up clasp in a containerized build environment
Remote server: Authenticating on a headless Linux server via SSH

cards.task: Use custom OAuth credentials for running functions
cards.description: Uses a custom OAuth client ID/secret file instead of clasp's default credentials.
cards.whenToUse: When you need organization-specific OAuth credentials or when setting up clasp run.
scenarios: Enterprise deployment: Using your company's OAuth client for security compliance
Function execution: Setting up credentials required for 'clasp run'
Multiple environments: Different credentials for dev, staging, and production
